oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of women workers at Vultee Aircraft Plant, Nashville, Tennessee, 1941-1945
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of women building planes at Vultee Aircraft, 1941-1945. The plant built P-38 Lightning fighters and the Vultee Vengeance dive bombers during World War II. The Vultee plant opened on 04 May 1941 and over the years has produced more than 10,000 wings and tail sections, among them helicopter parts used by the military in Vietnam. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w : 8 x 10 in., mounted on cardboard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Vultee Aircraft, Inc.--History--Sources
